msContents.summary: Valuable collection of miscellaneous literary works, some exceedingly rare, labelled Majmūʿah-'i rasāʾil-i nas̲r; transcribed in clear Indian taʿlīq in multiple directions and arrangements; larger compositions are generally treated as individual tractates, while smaller compositions are later clustered together; heavily annotated in parts by later hands. Not dated. Blank folios at end (29 ff.). Unbound, delaminating boards detached, spine fragmentary; folios cropped; some folios are torn and creased; many folios detached from gathering; wormholes; fragile. Foliated in Arabic numerals, with English stamped foliation in parts only.

note.p: Journal in refined prose and verse recording the seige and conquest of the Quṭb Shāhī capital Ḥaydar'ābād (Andhra Pradesh) by the Timurid or Mughal Emperor ʿĀlamgīr I (Aurangzeb) in 1097/1686, composed by the minister and poet "Mīrzā Muḥammad" Nūr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Fatḥ al-Dīn Niʿmat Khān (also known as Muqarrab Khān and Dānishmand Khān) with the takhalluṣ ʿĀlī (d. 1121/1709)
